answers.answer: Hi, as the ASD has been asymptomatic, its unlikely it will cause problems now. Follow up with your doctor for monitoring and blood pressure medications are modified based on your present pressures. Diabetes Mellitus is a lifelong metabolic disorder. Successful therapy requires lifelong commitment. It involves monitoring blood sugar levels, leading a healthy lifestyle and working towards preventing any serious complications that may be caused by diabetes. But don't worry though it is a lifelong disorder, it can be adequately controlled. So, keep monitoring your blood pressure and blood sugar values and follow up with your doctor. Regards.

question: I am 52 years old and I had good sporting/ exercise through out my schooling/ childhood and had no problem of any kind. Last month during two nights I got at 3pm or so having fearful feeling.  When I visited doctor he advised for BP check up it came 100/158, 100/185, 100/160 on 3 occasions.  He advised me for preventive health check up and advised to take amlong 5mg. On preventive health check up ECG was ok but BP and sugar (F110/PP160) was present.  I consulted Medical Specialist who advised me to reduce weight and salt and no need to take medicine for sugar, you go for a walk morning and evening.  He also advised for ECHO.  After undergoing ECHO it was detected that I had an ASD of 10mm.  Since that day I am feeling scary.  When I met Cardiologist he told me ECHO is ok and ASD of 10mm does not make any difference to me as in the past.  He changed my BP medicine from amlong 5mg to Amlong H (5+12.5) and Glumorfin XL 1000mg for sugar.  Please advise whether I should rest assured that ASD is not risky and change of medicines as advised by Cardiologist.  SURINDER (SSC_1962)
title: ASD of 10mm
